meanings.definition: To assess or determine the new value or worth of something.
meanings.sent1: The appraiser revalued the antique vase to see if its price had changed.
meanings.sent2: After renovations, the house was revalued at a higher price.
meanings.sent3: The students revalued their collection of trading cards for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her perspective on life revalued after the near-death experience.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick revalued the audience's perception of reality.

meanings.definition: To increase the value of something.
meanings.sent1: The strategic marketing campaign revalued the company's brand.
meanings.sent2: Investing in education can revalue a person's skills and knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain revalued the importance of carrying an umbrella.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness revalued the meaning of true friendship.
meanings.sent5: The rare diamond revalued the entire jewelry collection.

meanings.definition: To reconsider or reevaluate the value of something.
meanings.sent1: The team decided to revalue their approach to the project for better results.
meanings.sent2: It's important to periodically revalue your goals to stay motivated.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to revalue its decision to chase the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected win revalued their perception of the underdog team.
meanings.sent5: The sudden loss revalued the importance of teamwork in sports.
